summary.text:
Style
-----
A representation of Style tag.

content.text:
Ansh Sharma

TODO:
 - Instead of using classes from public/style/index.css
   every component will have its own exportCss function.
 - These generated classes will be dumped into the

folder.
 - Style folder will be created for each page or for each style component.
 - And included into head of page that contains that style component.

summary.text: The html tag it is supposed to represent.

text.comment: The html tag it is supposed to represent.

summary.text: HTMl attributes in the form of key value pairs.

text.comment: HTMl attributes in the form of key value pairs.

summary.text: An array of
`Component`

which would be rendered as
child elements of the current element

text.comment: An array of Component which would be rendered as child elements of the current element

summary.text: Get the tag name

content.text:
```js
var tag = myComponent.getTag(); // a div component
console.log(tag); // div
```

text.comment:
Get the tag name

Returns:

the tag of the component

Example:
var tag = myComponent.getTag(); // a div component
console.log(tag); // div

summary.text: Get the attributes of the component

content.text: Object containing all the attributes of the component

text.comment:
Get the attributes of the component

Returns:

Object containing all the attributes of the component

Example:
var myComponent = new Component("div",{"id":"my-component"});
var attributes = myComponent.getAttributes(); // a div component
console.log(attributes); // {"id":"my-component"};

summary.text: Get the children of the component

content.text: List of all the Childrens of the component

text.comment:
Get the children of the component

Returns:

List of all the Childrens of the component

summary.text: Get the parent of the component

text.comment:
Get the parent of the component

Returns:

Parent of the component

summary.text: Sets or Creates a new attribute on the component
nmae of the attribute to set

text.comment: nmae of the attribute to set

summary.text: the value of the attribute to set

text.comment: the value of the attribute to set

Sets or Creates a new attribute on the component

Example:

var myComponent = new Component("p");
myComponent.setAttribute("class", "my-component para lg:mx-5 sm:mx-1");
myComponent.setAttribute("id","my-unique-id");

summary.text: Get the value of the attribute at the specified name
the value of the attribute to get

text.comment: the value of the attribute to get

Get the value of the attribute at the specified name

Returns:

the value of the attribute

summary.text: Remove the attribute at the specified name
Attribute to remove from the component

text.comment: Attribute to remove from the component
Remove the attribute at the specified name

summary.text: Add a new child to the component

content.text:
```js
 var component1 = new Component("div"); // parent component
 var component2 = new Component("p"); // child component
 component1.addChild(component2);

```

summary.text: Add a child to the component. Child can be of any level of inheritance of component.

text.comment: Add a child to the component. Child can be of any level of inheritance of component.

Add a new child to the component

Example:
 var component1 = new Component("div"); // parent component
 var component2 = new Component("p"); // child component
 component1.addChild(component2);
Deprecated:

Use addChildren instead

summary.text: Add multiple children to the component

content.text:
```js
 var component1 = new Component("div"); // parent component
 var component2 = new Component("p"); // child component
 component1.addChildren(component2);

```

summary.text: A destructured list of components to add as children

text.comment: A destructured list of components to add as children

Add multiple children to the component

Example:
 var component1 = new Component("div"); // parent component
 var component2 = new Component("p"); // child component
 component1.addChildren(component2);

summary.text:
Remove the child from the parent.
Note if the child is not refrenced anywhere but only by the parent, then remove it will delete it.
The children component to remove as a child

text.comment: The children component to remove as a child
Remove the child from the parent. Note if the child is not refrenced anywhere but only by the parent, then remove it will delete it.

summary.text: Add multiple classes to the list of classes

content.text:
```js
 var myComponent = new Component("div");
 myComponent.addClasses("mx-5"); // class = "mx-5"
 myComponent.addClasses("my-1"); // class = "my-1" "mx-5"
```

summary.text: the destructured string array of class names to add to the component

text.comment: the destructured string array of class names to add to the component

Add multiple classes to the list of classes

Example:
 var myComponent = new Component("div");
 myComponent.addClasses("mx-5"); // class = "mx-5"
 myComponent.addClasses("my-1"); // class = "my-1" "mx-5"

summary.text: The CSS classes and their properties.

text.comment: The CSS classes and their properties.

summary.text: URL to an external source file.

text.comment: URL to an external source file.

summary.text:
Type of the CSS attachment. Either inline or external.
Note: inline attachments are supported under Attributes, and Style functions under Component.

text.comment: Type of the CSS attachment. Either inline or external. Note: inline attachments are supported under Attributes, and Style functions under Component.

summary.text: Create a new instance of Style.
The type of the CSS attachment. Either inline or external.

text.comment: The type of the CSS attachment. Either inline or external.

summary.text: URL to an external source file. Optional.

text.comment: URL to an external source file. Optional.

summary.text: The CSS classes and their properties.

text.comment: The CSS classes and their properties.
Create a new instance of Style.

summary.text: Adds a new CSS class with the specified properties.
The name of the CSS class to add.

text.comment: The name of the CSS class to add.

summary.text: The properties to associate with the new CSS class.

text.comment: The properties to associate with the new CSS class.
Adds a new CSS class with the specified properties.

summary.text: Updates the properties of an existing CSS class.
The name of the CSS class to update.

text.comment: The name of the CSS class to update.

summary.text: The updated properties to associate with the CSS class.

text.comment: The updated properties to associate with the CSS class.
Updates the properties of an existing CSS class.

summary.text: Removes an existing CSS class.
The name of the CSS class to remove.

text.comment: The name of the CSS class to remove.
Removes an existing CSS class.

summary.text: Adds the given properties to the specified class. If the class does not exist, it will be created.
The name of the class to add properties to.

text.comment: The name of the class to add properties to.

summary.text: An object containing the properties to add, where the key is the property name and the value is the property value.

text.comment: An object containing the properties to add, where the key is the property name and the value is the property value.
Adds the given properties to the specified class. If the class does not exist, it will be created.

summary.text: Removes the given properties from the specified class. If the class no longer has any properties, it will be removed.
The name of the class to remove properties from.

text.comment: The name of the class to remove properties from.

summary.text: An object containing the properties to remove, where the key is the property name and the value is the property value.

text.comment: An object containing the properties to remove, where the key is the property name and the value is the property value.
Removes the given properties from the specified class. If the class no longer has any properties, it will be removed.

summary.text: Updates the given properties of the specified class. If the class does not exist, it will be created.
The name of the class to update properties of.

text.comment: The name of the class to update properties of.

summary.text: An object containing the properties to update, where the key is the property name and the value is the property value.

text.comment: An object containing the properties to update, where the key is the property name and the value is the property value.
Updates the given properties of the specified class. If the class does not exist, it will be created.

summary.text: Gets the properties of an existing CSS class.

content.text: The properties of the specified CSS class, or undefined if the CSS class does not exist.

summary.text: The name of the CSS class to get the properties of.

text.comment: The name of the CSS class to get the properties of.

Gets the properties of an existing CSS class.

Returns:

The properties of the specified CSS class, or undefined if the CSS class does not exist.

summary.text:
Exports the CSS classes and their properties as a string.
Returns a <style> tag if the type is inline, otherwise returns the CSS classes and their properties as a string.

content.text: A string representation of the CSS classes and their properties.

text.comment: Exports the CSS classes and their properties as a string. Returns a

Style

A representation of Style tag.

Author:

Ansh Sharma

TODO:

  • Instead of using classes from public/style/index.css every component will have its own exportCss function.
  • These generated classes will be dumped into the build/[name]/style/ folder.
  • Style folder will be created for each page or for each style component.
  • And included into head of page that contains that style component.
